snippet: The study compared 25 rural Rwandan clinics that offered AIDS treatment with 25 similar clinics that did not.
abstract: Study by Brandeis University health policy analysts in The American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene finds that large donations toward fighting AIDS in poor African countries do not necessarily detract from addressing other local medical problems.
lead_paragraph: The study compared 25 rural Rwandan clinics that offered AIDS treatment with 25 similar clinics that did not.

headline.seo: AIDS Funds Don’t Detract From Rwanda’s Other Health Goals
headline.main: Flood of Donations to Fight AIDS Appears Not to Detract From Other Health Issues
headline.print_headline: Rwanda: Flood of Donations to Fight AIDS Appears Not to Detract From Other Health Issues

keywords.value: American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene
keywords.name: organizations
